result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas N Matke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

*Pay costs

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

records.addlTxt: /s/ TBE 04/19/16 - NOW THEREFORE, IT IS ORDERED that the sum of $332.75 shall be paid to Attorney Dalkert - original filed in 15CM471
Request for payment of services - see attached itemized bill /s/ TBE 04/19/16 - Purchase Order dated 04/20/16 - original filed in 15CM471

Defendant Thomas N. Matke in court with attorney Melissa Hope Dalkert. Atty Louis Molepske appearing for Elizabeth R. Constable on behalf of the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CM471 and 15CM530.

8:40 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Atty Molepske indicates victim notification had been complied with and no victim's appear in Court today.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CM471:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - No contest 

15CM530:
Count 1 - No contest 
Count 2 - No contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 2 of 15CM471 and Count 1 is DRI and guilty on Count 1 & 2 of 15CM530.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Dalkert makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CM471:
Count 1 - DRI

Count 2 -
Impose/Stay jail sentence of 6 months
**Placed on Probation for a period of 24 months:
If probation revoked huber priveleges for work, counseling or any other reason the Sheriff will allow.
Serve second half on the electronic home monitor if approved by jail and risk assessment
*1 day jail credit
Conditions of Probation:
*Pay costs - including DNA Surcharge and Domestic Abuse Surcharge
*If probation is successfully completed may be allowed early discharge if approved by the agent
*AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
*Obtain prescriptions from one pharmacy
*Sign all releases so agent can monitor the prescription medications 
*Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:   Sylvia Worzella without agent approval
*Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
*Participate in any counseling and assessments recommended by the agent; if domestic abuse program recommended needs to comply.
*Provide DNA Sample
*Write letter of apology to Sylvia Worzella within next 30 days and provide to agent to forward to victim
*Cash bond of $150 to be applied to costs

15CM530:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay jail sentence of 3 months - concurrent to 15CM471
If probation revoked huber priveleges for work, counseling or any other reason the Sheriff will allow.
**Placed on Probation for a period of 24 months:
*1 day jail credit (this credit is for both counts 1 & 2)
Conditions of Probation:
*Comply with conditions in 15CM471
*Pay costs - DNA Surcharge

Count 2 - 
Impose/Stay jail sentence of 30 days - concurrent to Count 1 and 15CM471
If probation revoked huber priveleges for work, counseling or any other reason the Sheriff will allow.
**Placed on Probation for a period of 24 months:
Conditions of Probation:
*Comply with conditions in 15CM471
*Pay costs - No DNA Surcharge

Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Defendant indicates he is not eligible for a Public Defender.

NOT GUILTY plea entered by the Court.

Court advises the defendant of process for court appointed attorney. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
